content.question: The effects of deindustrialization in the 1970s included all of the following EXCEPT

choices.label: the increasing importance of the service sector of the economy
plant shutdowns and closings, particularly in what came to be called the Rust Belt
an increased United States share of the world market in manufacturing
the erosion of tax bases in many communities, leading to cutbacks in health and welfare services
a decrease in real wages for United States workers in the manufacturing sector

content.answer: an increased United States share of the world market in manufacturing
